name: Amazon
overview: Amazon operates an online shopping site, music and video streaming platform, and cloud services as core parts of their business. Amazon collects a sizeable amount of consumer data, including from other sites through its advertising platform.

issues.content: Poor internal security has led to many data leaks and incidents of malicious activity. Employees have been caught accessing customer information without a legitimate purpose, and in some cases selling customer data and even accepting bribes. At one point, an internal cache of American Express credit cards numbers was discovered. This is despite the fact that Amazon says they are compliant with PCI DSS, the security standard set forth by the payment card industry

Amazon Web Services (AWS) hosts the web servers of companies in many sectors. In 2019, security vulnerabilities with AWS were exploited by a former employee, who gained access to the personal data of over 100 million Capital One customers. This data included sensitive information like social security numbers

Amazon has faced criticism over its storage of voice recordings collected from Alexa smart home products. This storage often occurs without the knowledge of the device's owner since it is enabled by default

Other significant privacy issues discovered with Amazon Alexa relate to third-party 'skills' that aren't well-regulated. These problems range from missing and inaccurate privacy policies to security vulnerabilities such as the ability to modify back-end code after approval of the skill
